p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; text-decoration: underline;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “What can parents and students expect of teachers?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Teachers will be working on lesson plans and extended learning opportunities throughout the week of March 23

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: . The District will required teachers to post “virtual office hours” during our closure, and ask that they communicate with stakeholders though e-mail, phone, and/or video conferencing. Individual teachers’ hours will be posted on the teacher's Springtown ISD website.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “What are the expectations of students?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Students will be permitted to complete assignments at any time within the assigned work week

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: and should contact their content area teacher with questions (including technology-related questions) throughout the closure.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “Where can students and parents find lessons?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Parents and students will access lessons and activities through the teacher's Google Classroom. The link for individual Google Classrooms will be located on each teacher's Springtown ISD website.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “How much work will my student be expected to complete?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Amounts of work are largely dependent upon the grade level. A student will not be asked to complete unreasonable amounts of work, and activities should not require initial instruction from parents/guardians or other caretakers. A student may need some assistance just as they would on typical homework. If work becomes overwhelming and time-consuming, please make a note for your student’s teacher and move on to the next activity.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; text-decoration: underline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; text-decoration: normal;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “My child told me that Springtown will be closed for the rest of the year. Is this true?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: On Thursday, March 19

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: , Governor Abbott issued a proclamation

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

em.strong: closing all Texas’ k-12 schools to students until midnight April 3

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; text-decoration: underline;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: . At this time, Springtown ISD is preparing to distribute meals for students and planning professional development for teachers during the week of March 23

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: – March 27

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: . Extended learning opportunities (through

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: methods) will be prepared the week after Spring Break, and distributed to students beginning March 30

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; text-decoration: normal;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “What are the Districts plans regarding food service? Is our Child Nutrition Department going to be able to provide assistance during this closure?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: Springtown ISD’s Child Nutrition Department is committed to making meals available to our students during this closure, and will begin offering

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: to our students on the Monday following Spring Break (March 23

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: ). Any child under the age of 18 will be eligible to pick up a

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

em.strong: lunch and breakfast for the following day

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: at SMS, SES, and RES at entrances nearest the bus lanes at each of those campuses (link to maps), but must be physically present in order to meet state and federal guidelines. These sites will be open from 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM Monday through Friday of next week. In addition to the “Grab-n-Go” meals available at the campuses, the district will deliver meals to two locations east of Springtown. The first mobile “Grab-n-Go” will be near the intersection of Valley Meadows Drive and Hilltop Meadows Drive. The second mobile “Grab-n-Go” will be just east of David’s Patio on Sunset Drive near Monticello Drive. The mobile sites will serve "Grab-n-Go" meals from 11-11:30 AM.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: Later next week, the District plans to begin providing delivery of meals to students living more than two miles from Springtown Elementary or Reno Elementary “Grab-n-Go” stations. Parents may request this service by signing up through either an online survey being opened on our website beginning Saturday, or by completing paperwork available at the “Grab-n-Go” station at SES and RES. *

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

em.strong: Please note that dining in the cafeterias is NOT an option; “Grab-n-Go only

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; text-decoration: underline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; text-decoration: normal;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “How will students without internet be taught when school is closed?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: Unless the District is closed

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: beyond March 27

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: students will not be asked to send any work in. The District will use this time to for professional development activities

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: in case

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: a more lengthy closure is necessary. If an extended closure is necessary, the District intends to extend learning opportunities via digital platforms (‘high tech’ or online work)

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: traditional paper packets of work (‘low tech’). Our staff recognizes that not all of our students have access to the internet or to digital devices such as laptops, chromebooks, or tablets.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; text-decoration: underline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; text-decoration: normal;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “Is it true that the SAT has been cancelled?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: The College Board’s website stated that the makeup testing date of March 28

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: has been cancelled, as was the regular SAT testing date of May 2

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: . The ACT appears to have moved their April 4

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: testing date to June 13

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “Have any of Springtown ISD’s students or parents contracted COVID-19?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: At this time, the TDSHS information

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: confirmed cases in Parker County.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “Prom?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: Beginning midnight March 17

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: , the City of Fort Worth has ordered a mandatory “reduction of occupancy” limiting occupancy of bars, event centers, gyms, hotel restaurants, retail stores, theaters, convenience stores, public buildings, plazas, churches and shopping malls by 50% , or no more than 125 individuals, whichever is less.

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

em.strong: At this time, we do not know when this restriction might expire

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: . Whether or not the venue is available on April 18

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: will not be up to Springtown ISD. It would be a good idea to begin preparing an alternative plan. While it may not come to pass, this potential is disappointing to everyone involved. We will forward definitive information as it becomes available.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “Are students still expected to return to school on March 30th?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: As of March 17

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: , the District’s plan is to remain closed to students until March 30

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: . Recognizing the concern some students and parents might have when classes resume, the District will forward information about attendance options at the appropriate time. There are many, many variables that might influence a change to our current plans, but until further notice March 30

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: remains our target return date.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; text-decoration: underline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “So are we going to have a prom?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: We’re getting that question a lot due to a rumor posted on Facebook.

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: we have not cancelled the Prom scheduled for April 18

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: (nor have we postponed the event).

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: Prom is more than a month away…circumstances may warrant a change to any or all events currently scheduled for the month of April.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “On Tuesday, Boyd ISD notified parents that they will be closed for a third week; will SPRINGTOWN do the same?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: There are several neighboring districts who have already announced plans to close through April 3

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: . At this time, Springtown ISD hopes to resume classes March 30

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: . As of March 16

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: , Parker County has zero (0) confirmed cases of COVID-19; we will continue to monitor the TDSHS website and communicate with local and regional health officials. It is important to emphasize that our current situation is very fluid and subject to change.

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

em.strong: Social distancing is a key component of the CDC’s plan to slow the progress of this virus.

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: ANY CHANGE TO OUR PLANS WILL BE PUBLISHED THROUGH OUR WEBSITE, FACEBOOK PAGE, THE SPRINGTOWN EPIGRAPH, AND OUR AUTOMATED CALLING SYSTEM (ParentLink)

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: justify; text-indent: -77px; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “I heard the STAAR test has been cancelled. Is this true?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: Monday morning, Governor Abbott waived Texas’ STAAR testing requirements for the remainder of the 2019-2020 term. Although the announcement (technically) did not waive

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: all testing

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: , our understanding is that the intention was to cancel STAAR testing for all grades for the remainder of the year. The Governor’s announcement also indicated he would appeal to the U.S. Department of Education and request that they also waive federal testing requirements for the remainder of the academic year.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “Will parents be called when these online assignments start?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: Absolutely! As most of you know, this week our students and staff are on “Spring Break.” Several members of our Administrative Team have been working all weekend and will continue working during Spring Break to prepare plans for how distance learning might occur during our school closure. Information about the assignment pick-up and/or digital availability will be delivered through our website, the District’s Facebook page, and our ParentLink automated calling system.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “Any updates on the prepackaged lunches?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: We spent quite a bit of time this weekend putting together options for how we could provide lunches

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: after Spring Break

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: . Unfortunately, some of the plans to prepare and then deliver the food relied on a degree of flexibility the Department of Agriculture cannot immediately provide. We are revising our plans and will communicate them through our Website, Facebook, and ParentLink calling system when they are more concrete (and meet Dept. of Ag. requirements).

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “I would like to volunteer for the District and deliver food for the children. How can I do that?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: At this time, it appears that the guidelines provided by the Dept. of Agriculture will not allow us to deliver food directly to individual homes. We greatly appreciate the fact that many individuals and several area churches have offered to help coordinate volunteers, and will utilize those resources as much as we are able when we have more information.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; text-decoration: underline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: center; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “Why is the District cancelling classes for two weeks if no students are even sick?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: Springtown ISD’s 2019-2020 School Calendar already included a “Spring Break” for the week of March 16

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: the closure/cancellation of classes is for one week following Spring Break (March 23

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: . The closure following Spring Break mirrors similar efforts in districts across the state to minimize the speed and scale of COVID-19’s spread.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “My child is enrolled in a Dual Credit course. How will work be turned in to Weatherford College if Springtown ISD is closed?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: Weatherford College announced a change to their schedule as well…the College plans to re-open March 30

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “Why is Springtown ISD returning to class on March 30

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: when neighboring districts are closed until April?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: Districts across the state have the authority to make decisions based on local circumstances.

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: At this time, Springtown ISD intends to re-open on Monday, March 30

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: . A list of statewide closures can be found on TEA’s website through this link:

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “Does this mean that our children will have to go to school in June?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: The District’s calendar includes additional minutes beyond the mandated 75,600. Our campuses have some time built into our schedule that can be used in the same manner as a “bad weather day.” Once those minutes are depleted, our plan is to utilize distance learning (whether digital/online or through more traditional packets of work sent home for students to complete) to continue delivering instruction. The Texas Education Agency, through our Commissioner of Education, has provided guidance for waiver applications that might also be utilized.

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: At this time, we do not anticipate extending our school year.

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “What about students in the free or reduced lunch program? Two weeks is a long time…”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: This concern is always a factor when discussions begin regarding cancellation/ delay/ closure of schools. “Bad weather days” make delivery or pickup programs difficult during inclement weather. This particularly unique situation, however, may allow the District to provide meals for students despite campuses being closed. Our Food Service Director is working with other district administrators to review options for meeting a need we know exists in our schools and community. Details will follow guidance from the USDA and the Texas Education Agency in the coming week.

p.span: “I read that all extra-curricular events are cancelled and that the UIL shut down games and contests. Is the season over?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: The University Interscholastic League SUSPENDED all UIL-sanctioned contests effective March 16

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: - March 29

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: . As of March 13

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: , no season has been cancelled. *The State Basketball Tournament was suspended following the 3A Semifinals.

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: “I have a senior…how will this impact the Prom and Graduation?”

p.style: margin-left: 1px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 77px; text-align: left; text-indent: -77px;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: The Senior Prom is scheduled for April 18

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: , well after our proposed closure. Our Commencement Ceremony is scheduled for Friday, May 22

sup.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 9.599999999999998px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.em: . Our plan is to use distance learning for the week following our school closure and avoid altering the date for an event as significant as Commencement. Even if further closure were necessary, it is not completely unheard of that a graduation ceremony could be held prior to the conclusion of courses. Not many years ago, Commencement was held at the Fort Worth Convention Center prior to the end of the semester…not an ideal situation, but it has been done.
